author: dlr
msg: Incremental progress on both DAV server and client fronts towards
L10N.  Client expected to function, but server and intl module not yet
functional.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/util.c
(parsed_request): Removed use of setlocale() in favor of the locale
stored in the gettext .po bundles.  lunblad came up with a scheme
where each message bundle will declare its locale, obviating any
complicated machinations to emulate the cross-platform locale
look-up logic found in gettext.  Bundles still need this
information added to them.  Bundles that do not declare this
information will not send an Accept-Language header to the server.
* subversion/include/svn_intl.h
(SVN_CLIENT_MESSAGE_LOCALE): gettext msgid corresponding to the
locale for the .po file in use by the client.
(svn_intl_initialize): Added note about module lifetime to doc
string.
(svn_intl_terminate): Removed API.  Unnecessary, since this can be
managed via the apr_pool_t used to initialize the library.
(svn_intl_set_locale_prefs): New API for setting the locale
preferences for the current context (only).  Defaults to global
locale.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/intl.c
#include apr_thread_proc.h, locale.h, and libintl.h.
(private_pool): Explicitly initialize static variable to NULL.
(svn_intl_terminate): Re-incarnate function as a cleanup hook for
private_pool.  Null out file static variables cache_lock (does this
need explicit release?) and private_pool.
(svn_intl_initialize): Ignore attempts at re-initialization before
private_pool has been cleaned up and nulled out by
svn_intl_terminate().  Current implementation is likely quite
buggy.  We may want to pass in a dedicated pool, rather than a
parent pool from which to allocate a sub-pool.
(svn_intl_set_locale_prefs): New API, currently unimplemented.  Must
be implemented before this library is really useful.
(svn_intl_dgettext): The start of a dgettext() implementation for
use in the _() macro in svn_private_config.h which derives the
locale from teh current context.  It will need an actual context
parameter if we decide not to go with thread-local storage (as it
currently assumes).
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/mod_dav_svn.c
(dav_svn_init): Call svn_intl_initialize() and handle any errors.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/dav_svn.h
(svn_dav__negotiate_lang_prefs): Declare a new module-private API
which determine the language preferences based on any
Accept-Language header(s) present in the request.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/lang.c
The start of a language negotiation implementation for mod_dav_svn.
(accept_rec, get_entry, do_header_line): Data structure and function
cribbed from mod_negotiation.c and stripped down to the bare
necessities.  Coming straight from httpd, these should be in
working order.
(sort_lang_pref): qsort input.
(svn_dav__negotiate_lang_prefs): Parses the Accept-Language header,
and returns the result as an array of strings.  There may be bugs
here in the conversion code.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/repos.c
(dav_svn_get_resource): As this function runs for most (if not all
DAV requests), call svn_dav__negotiate_lang_prefs(), log any errors
which occur, and continue processing (failures should fall back to
traditional gettext behavior).
* subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/intl-test.c
(l10n_t): New internal data type for organizing test inputs.
(test1): Used sub-pool, and statically allocated l10n_list of l10n_t
structures.

author: lundblad
msg: Make svn status --xml output include base revisions and last committed info.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/status.c
(svn_cl__print_status_xml): Print base revision and last committed info
for the entry.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/dtd/status.dtd:
Add revision attribute to wc-status element.
Add commit, author and date elements and modify content model of wc-status
to allow commit element.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/stat_tests.py
(status_in_xml): Update expected output to include the new information.
Shorten too long line.

author: dlr
msg: * subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/util.c
(parsed_request): Restored call to setlocale() accidently removed in

author: dlr
msg: * subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/util.c
(parsed_request): LC_MESSAGES isn't available on Windows, but we
could use LC_ALL when calling setlocale() there.  However, Windows
and some Linux may return friendly aliases for the language and
country codes, which do not appear to be permitted per section 3.10
of RFC 2616.  ifdef'd out sending of Accept-Language on Windows
(general solution in the works).  Duplicate the return value of
setlocale(), since we'll be manipulating that memory (and it could
be read-only).
